result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: See DAGP document for details of agreement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart J Dantoin

defendant.name: Dantoin, Stuart J
defendant.address: 1717 W North Shore Avenue, Chicago, IL 60626

records.addlTxt: CK 44065 mailed to poster; signature bond ordered.

Conditions: 
No contact with D.K., her mother, or her residence.
No presence on or in the University of Wisconsin- Eau Claire property.
No use of social media except for legitimate academic or employment purposes. 
No use of the internet except for legitimate and documented work/educational purposes.

(Case called at 10:28 AM)
Defendant Stuart Dantoin appears with Attorney Ryan Moertel.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defense outlines the agreement for the Court.   Defendant is advised of the charge, elements, and maximum possible penalties.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing - waiver accepted by Court.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Stalking.  Defendant acknowledges Plea Questionnaire.  Court finds the plea has been entered freely and voluntarily.  Court does not find the Defendant guilty in accordance with the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea (DAGP) agreement.  Bond amended to signature bond (cash to be refunded) and modified condition regarding use of social media.  10 days sentence credit is noted for the record.
DAGP Return Hearing: July 12, 2023 at 9:30 AM

Conditions: 
No contact with D.K., her mother, or her residence.
No presence on or in the University of Wisconsin- Eau Claire property.
No use of social media except for legitimate academic or employment purposes. 
No use of the internet except for legitimate and documented work/educational purposes.
Plea hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
